messages.message: @Aaron Tami these continue to fail.  This is blocking the certify release.  Have you had a chance to look into these?

@shaunak will look at the sandboxes again, do you know which certifications we are missing?

22.10 was successfully certified
23.01 was successfully certified
23.04 was successfully certified but the git release failed to create, the team has been looking into this ongoing issue
23.07: This one is actually broken, @shiqi is looking into this one right now
23.10 was successfully certified
24.01 was successfully certified

For sandboxes, there are a lot of transient issues that we are still working through, but all have had a successful run in the last 24 hours except:

23.07 (broken)
23.10 pipeline keeps timing out, but the upgrade flow finished

one of the issue is that weekly automated certify checks those release sandboxes to only proceed if the last deployment is successful, since 23.07 is broken we always had to manually certify that one and some times we just miss that in the list of releases to certify (based on my observations on the previous few weeks)

the current 23.07 certify brokerage this morning was actually caused by the release system bug that was reverted, meanwhile we do have another issue that broke the  release bundle generation on all release before 23.10, that I am fixing
ok, 23.07 was the main one.  And I think 23.01 was also not successful.
23.01 was successfully certified, publishing the release bundle failed though, and we reran it manually.  This should not block vulnerability scanning
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/55785 we have an issue in 23.01/23.04/23.07 for release bundle generation, this should fix that
